<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Thoughtsense](/Feats.aspx?ID=3676) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Occult" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=120" />
<trait label="Psychic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=430" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 27</row>

</column>

---

You can detect the flickers of mental activity let off by all thinking creatures. You gain thoughtsense as a [vague](/Rules.aspx?ID=413) sense that has a range of 30 feet—like all vague senses, it's only about as precise as an average human's sense of smell, meaning you generally can predict only if a creature is present. Your thoughtsense detects only thinking creatures, so a creature that is unthinking or otherwise immune to mental effects (such as many constructs and oozes) can't be perceived using your thoughtsense, regardless of how precise it is. 

While your [Psyche is Unleashed](/Actions.aspx?ID=1222), your thoughtsense upgrades to an imprecise [sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=412), letting you use it to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) out creatures.
name: Thoughtsense
